Mapper()

new Mapper instances are always interactive by default. If you want automation mode, set isInteractive to false before calling saveRangeToDB

isInteractive

should the Mapper instance be used interactively, thus giving error messages to the user or used in automation mode (invoked by VBA, needs to be explicitly set), collecting error messages for later retrieval

| Improve this Doc View Source

saveRangeToDB(Range, String, String, String, Int32, Boolean, String)

dump data given in dataRange to a database table specified by tableName and connID this database table can have multiple primary columns specified by primKeysStr assumption: layout of dataRange is primKey1Val,primKey2Val,..,primKeyNVal,DataCol1Val,DataCol2Val,..,DataColNVal

Declaration
public bool saveRangeToDB(Range DataRange, string tableName, string primKeysStr, string database, int env = 1, bool insertIfMissing = false, string executeAdditionalProc = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Range DataRange

Excel Range, where Data is taken from
System.String tableName

Database Table, where Data is to be stored
System.String primKeysStr

String containing primary Key names for updating table data, comma separated
System.String database

Database to replace D
System.Int32 env

Environment where connection id should be taken from
System.Boolean insertIfMissing

then insert row into table if primary key is missing there. Default = False (only update)
System.String executeAdditionalProc

additional stored procedure to be executed after saving
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

True if successful, false in case of errors.
